documentType: Case Initiation Summary / FBI Investigative Report
summary: This FBI case initiation summary outlines the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking of minors, beginning in 2018. It details the historical abuse from at least 2002, the 2019 indictment and arrest of Epstein, subsequent investigative steps, his death in custody, and the ongoing investigation and eventual indictment and conviction of Ghislaine Maxwell. It also includes allegations against other associates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sex trafficking minors, creating a network of underage victims from at least 2002, and paying for sexual acts. Indicted in July 2019, arrested, and died by suicide in August 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as working with Epstein to facilitate the exploitation of minors. Served with a grand jury subpoena in July 2019, indicted in June 2020 and March 2021, arrested in July 2020, convicted in December 2021, and sentenced in June 2022.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Named as an individual associated with Epstein who was served a grand jury subpoena in July 2019. His attorneys later advised he would invoke his Fifth Amendment rights.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Named as an individual associated with Epstein served with a grand jury subpoena. His attorneys stated he and his wife were not close with Epstein, had no knowledge of his misconduct, and severed ties in 2007 after discovering Epstein stole from them.

persons.name: Abigail Wexner
persons.context: Wife of Leslie Wexner; represented by attorneys who gave a proffer stating the Wexners had no knowledge of Epstein's misconduct.

persons.name: William Hammond
persons.context: Named as a pilot for Epstein who was served a grand jury subpoena in July 2019.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Named as a pilot for Epstein who was served a grand jury subpoena in July 2019.

persons.name: Richard Barnett
persons.context: Identified as Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell's chief engineer; served a grand jury subpoena in July 2019.

persons.name: Gregory Bledsoe
persons.context: A doctor hired by the Secret Service for a 2002 trip to Africa on Epstein's plane with Bill Clinton. Interviewed by FBI/SDNY; stated he observed no minors or sexual misconduct on the flight.

persons.name: Nick Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate when Epstein was found unconscious in July 2019. A former police officer charged in a quadruple homicide. Denied knowledge of the incident.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Named by an adult victim who stated Epstein directed her to massage him. The victim alleged Black initiated sexual contact, causing her to run out. The Manhattan DA's office began looking into allegations against him.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Named by an adult victim who stated Epstein directed her to massage him. The victim alleged Staley forced her to touch his genitals and raped her at Epstein's NY residence.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned by a victim who described Epstein asking her to massage Weinstein, during which Weinstein asked her to remove her shirt. She refused and left.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a 2002 trip to Africa on Epstein's plane for which Dr. Bledsoe was hired by the Secret Service.

connections.description: Worked together to create and maintain a network of minor victims; Maxwell recruited victims and facilitated sexual encounters.
Epstein managed the Wexners' finances; they severed ties in 2007 after discovering Epstein had stolen hundreds of thousands of dollars from them.
Brunel was an associate served with a grand jury subpoena as part of the investigation into Epstein's network.
Hammond was a pilot for Epstein, served with a grand jury subpoena.
Rodgers was a pilot for Epstein, served with a grand jury subpoena.
Barnett was the chief engineer for Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, served with a grand jury subpoena.
An adult victim alleged Epstein directed her to massage Leon Black, who then initiated sexual contact.
An adult victim alleged Epstein directed her to massage Jes Staley, who then raped her.

events.title: Start of Epstein's Abuse Pattern
events.description: Epstein begins enticing and recruiting dozens of minor girls for sex acts, paying them hundreds of dollars, in New York and Florida.

events.title: Initial Police Investigation
events.description: West Palm Beach Police Department and FBI Miami initiate an investigation after parents report Epstein sexually abused their daughter from 2002-2005.

events.title: FBI Case Initiation
events.description: FBI NY initiates a case after SDNY contacts them regarding several victims sexually abused by Epstein in the mid-2000s.

events.title: Epstein Indicted
events.description: A federal grand jury in SDNY returns a sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein Arrested
events.description: Epstein is arrested at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey and transported to New York. A search warrant is executed at his Manhattan residence.

events.title: Epstein Pleads Not Guilty
events.description: Epstein pleads not guilty during his initial appearance in federal court.

events.title: Epstein Found Unconscious in Cell
events.description: Epstein is found unconscious in his cell with marks on his neck. He is revived and claims not to recall what happened.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein commits suicide in his jail cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan.

events.title: Maxwell Indicted
events.description: A federal grand jury in SDNY returns a sealed indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell for enticement, conspiracy, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

events.title: Maxwell Arrested
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is arrested at her home in New Hampshire.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Begins
events.description: The trial United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell begins.

events.title: Maxwell Convicted
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is convicted on 5 counts.

events.title: Maxwell Sentenced
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is sentenced to 20 years in prison.

locations: Teterboro Airport, Bergen County, New Jersey
St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's property)
keyFacts: Epstein's abuse scheme began in at least 2002, involving dozens of minor girls as young as 14, whom he paid hundreds of dollars in cash for sexual acts, and he incentivized victims to recruit others.
Epstein was indicted on July 2, 2019, for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, and arrested on July 6, 2019, at Teterboro Airport.
Epstein died by suicide in his jail cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.
Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted, arrested, convicted, and sentenced to 20 years for her role in facilitating Epstein's sex trafficking of minors.

The investigation revealed allegations that Epstein directed victims to massage other powerful men, including Leon Black, Jes Staley, and Harvey Weinstein, with subsequent sexual assaults alleged against Black and Staley.
